Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Manhatten Balue for Money”
Reviews.Author: Virtualtourists21
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Washington Jefferson and only positive things to report. This was a great value break. We booked a Premier Room and it was just great- lovely shower room, and huge bed. I've stayed in three major ( expensive) Manhatten hotels before and the total package experience was just as good at WJ. I loved having the iPod dock, it made life so normal, as USA TV is appalling! The staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful. No frills just high quality customer care. We'd have liked the option if a drink or snack on site but since we were surrounded by eateries it wasn't an issue. Good location. Tucked away in a quiet street only a couple of blocks from Times Square, so close to busy thoroughfares but quite villagie ( if that's a word!). Would recommend and return again for a great value break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful at all times, great location. Rooms was cleaned every day with fresh towels.. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and saw 4 Broadway plays in one weekend. It was so convenient to the Broadway district, but tucked away on a quiet street lined with trees and cute cafes. Our room was small, but would not trade the convenience for one of the larger, chain hotels. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crazymum0169
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Washington Jefferson and honestly cant say enough good things about it. Had a bit of an issue when we arrived as we brought the wrong credit card but that was dealt with quickly. As we arrived a few hours before check in we were expecting to just leave our bags go out exploring and come back later but were pleasantly surprised when 1 of our rooms were ready. The rooms have everything u need for a base for your holiday, comfortable beds, storage and a good bathroom with a hairdryer.The location of the hotel is perfect. Really close to Times Square but far enough away that u dont get all the noise. The staff at this hotel were so helpful, they couldnt do enough for u and always went the extra mile if u had any questions or needed help with anything. All in all i had a fantastic time at this hotel and am already planning my next visit xxx

Reviews.Title: “OK stay, some problems”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: Considering it's a value hotel, the Washington Jefferson can be a reasonable alternative in New York. The property in general is in good shape, although looks a bit dated. My room and bathroom were quite small, although bright. The bed was average, nothing to complain about. However, I had a couple of electrical issues in my room: none of the two lamps worked. The issue was fixed quickly after I reported it, but I guess they could check this kind of things in advance. Complimentary, in room wi fi was also convenient. The location is quite good as well. The street is not particularly nice but it's 10 min from Times Square and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Global
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in mid-town, five minutes walk from Times Square and Broadway theatres. The rooms are clean and functional. They're small but it's adequate. I'd asked for a room off the street so it was very quiet except for the hum from the restaurant cooler on the ground floor - not enough to disturb my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and noisy”
Reviews.Author: HoytieToytie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and would look else where the next time we are in the city for a show. The positive aspect is that is is clean, inexpensive, and close to Broadway without actually being in the middle of it. The neighborhood is nice with some really great restaurants nearby. The negative is the extremely hard bed, and noise. The large window had no sound proofing what so ever, as well as the door to the room. Be prepared with an excellent pair of earplugs if you choose this hotel, and you want a good night sleep. The rooms are tiny, just enough for the bed and to barely walk around the bed. This is really not a concern to us but when in the city or traveling anywhere, we are just looking for a clean quiet room with a comfortable bed to make us happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Janine S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: absolutely clean, located right at Times Square, helpful staff. Matresses are a little hard for my taste, room could be painted and carpet could be exchanged, but other than that, the stay at this hotel was absolutely great. I rather pay a fair rate per night and the hotel room is moderate, than a remodeled hotelroom for an outrageous prize! One spends only time at the hotel to sleep anyways, therefore I was more than happy with my choice to stay there. I felt very comfy sleeping in this bed, as it made a very clean and maintained impression. The bathroom was nice as well! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: 5 night stay 10th-15th Feb 12. We booked this hotel as part of a flight/hotel package, and were aware, from reading reviews, that the rooms were going to be small. Yes, ours was, but it was just fine for what we wanted. We were rarely in there, other than to wash and sleep. The bathroom was a decent size and clean with plenty of towels and toiletries. There was an iron & board, a hairdryer and a free safe. The bed was lovely and ensured really good night sleeps, which were needed after all the walking we were doing. The staff were very pleasant, although we had no real cause to speak with them other than check-in, check-out and daily 'hello's'. It was so close to Broadway & Times Square too! If you want a clean and comfy base while you're on the move, I'd recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - a stones throw from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: steedge
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on price, trip advisor reviews and location. The hotel was literally 5 minutes walk to Times Square, right round the corner from the Broadway show 'Wicked' which we had coincidentally booked. The hotel room we stayed in, was, as previously discussed on Trip Advisor small. The bed however was extremely comfortable with lovely white linen and big fluffy white towels and our room including the bathroom was newly refurbished with a lovely power shower as per the pictures on their website. There was free wifi which was invalualbe to us planning our first NYC visit (me and my 16yr old daughter) from the comfort of our own room on our laptop. The only negative about the room apart from the size was the lighting. 3 side lights with no main lighting and a small window, made the room very dimly lit, although the bathroom lighting was very bright. Our first impression of the hotel was that it was smaller than we imagined and the reception area is pleasant although the corridors and the lift areas are in need of refurbishing but who sleeps in the corridor? There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and there is no on site restaurant for meals, snacks or room service although there is a Sushi restaurant within the same building. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and we took the hotel car back to the airport for a cost of $60 (inc toll) which was slightly more expensive than a cab but convenient as the hotel isn't on a main taxi route. We paid $50 in a yellow cab to the hotel. Overall we would return to the WJ because of the location, value for money, and room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: GiantScotsman
Reviews.Content: Young couple - we stayed here on a great trip to New York. The hotel is located 3 blocks from Times Square and right next to the Broadway theatres. The location is unbeatable. You can easily walk to all attractions in central Manhattan: Broadway, 5th Ave, Central Park etc. And getting the subway to the Financial District, Brooklyn, China Town etc. is easy (a local will always help you with the ticket machine when asked). Yes the rooms are small and hotel facilities are limited but the rooms were always clean and staff happy to help. Lets be honest, why would you go to New York to spend all your time in the hotel? If you want an excellent location to access NYC to its full potential stay here. If you want a hotel with massive rooms and fancy facilities, visit another city.

Reviews.Title: “Shortest Beds Ever”
Reviews.Author: kayPortland
Reviews.Content: A great location, clean, and quiet! Staff was accommodating though we did have to ask for more toiletries and towels! I was travelling with my daughter so we opted for twin beds. They were more like cots with a very hard mattress and even I at 5'9" hung way over the end of the bed. You can't even imagine how uncomfortable my 6' daughter was. They were not only short but HARD! Linens were all very nice! Don't underestimate the power of a good nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Chic”
Reviews.Author: jennifer t
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a girls weekend in New York, a first visit for us both. This hotel couldn't have been more perfect for us. The interior was clean and updated, the room was very neat and might I say 'quaint'. Location is perfect for easy access to all the great New York sites with coffee just a few steps away. Short on amenities that you might find at a larger hotel, that would be the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: PalesaM81
Reviews.Content: My review of this hotel is colored by the fact that when I stayed there I was sick from having been caught in unexpected snow Washington DC. This hotel is within a short walking distance from Times Square, there a subway station very close by and it is reasonably priced for such a nice location (although the entrance is a bit dodge). The rooms tough are quite small, the aircon unit kept me up when I desparately needed my sleep even after I changed rooms to a slightly bigger room and I could hear trucks in the mornings making deliveries. I got there feeling sick and left feeling exactly the same. I'm sure I'd I was healthy all these things wouldn't have mattered as much but as I was indeed sick, I really regretted forking out more for a better hotel :-(

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: msmelbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 nite, just to experience the Times Sq area. It's not right on Times Sq, thank god! It's about a 10mins walk. 10-15 min walk to a subway station. Location is ok. Rooms are super SMALL.. Seriously small. But for one nite it was ok for us, I couldn't imagine staying here for more than 2 nites, because it would have been too suffocating plus the heating and cooling didn't quite work as well, bathroom very small. I recommend it for single travelers with 1 luggage (If you have more it's a tight squeeze) and isn't planning a shopping spree, this will be perfect for you. However do your research for the money I think you can find something slightly better. Of course most things in this part of NYC is small as we have stayed in a couple of hotels in NYC before, however this was the smallest.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location and price, but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights on a business trip to NYC. The location and price were my main reasons for choosing it, and it could not have been more convenient to my business needs (all in midtown) and to restaurants. There is a subway stop (blue line) just around the corner, plus red, yellow, and orange trains within 2-3 blocks' walk. Plenty of eating and bars extremely close by, and the price (in January) was fantastic. However, the overall quality could improve. The room was very small, which didn't bother me, but also very dark-- no overhead light, only two small lamps. The bathroom had ample light, and I often left the bathroom door open to better illuminate the room. Wasn't working in the room, so again, not a huge issue. My room was on the third floor facing the street, and on one night, there was significant street noise from a bar opposite. Drilling in the street directly outside starting at 9am on several mornings-- annoying, but not severe, since I was getting ready for work by then. Bed was great, very clean and comfortable. Bathroom amenities excellent. Soft towels changed daily. No intrusive housekeeping service, but always efficient. The hotel advertises a 24-hour fitness center, but half of the equipment was busted and unusable. Lock to hold the seat in place on the exercise bike was broken, and the treadmill had an out-of-sort, "sorry for temporary unavailability" sign on it for my entire stay. Were they making an effort to get it repaired at all? The free weight bench was not broken. Room was a bit cold the first night, but fine all the others. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and efficient. On the whole, I would stay here again if the price were in this range. Next time I might personally change the lightbulbs to make the room brighter, and I'll hope that weather permits exercise in the Park. I've stayed at a Holiday Inn nearby, with much bigger rooms and fewer issues, but this definitely had an even better location.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: trak83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Washington Jefferson as part of our honeymoon in January last year. The staff were really friendly and always ready to help. They would follow up on things and also check if we needed help with directions or even activities for the day. Rooms were nicely decorated though very small. There was actually no room to walk around the room with 2 luggage bags sitting together, the bags had to be opened on the bed. There was no minibar (switch I needed to store medication). A major issue with the room was the fact that we couldn't control the temperature. We were there in the middle of winter and had to leave the window open to cool the room down. It would be -10C outside but 40C inside. We complained to reception about it but there was nothing they could do as there was one control for the whole hotel and the hotel was completely booked out. Bathroom is also small with only a sink, shower and toilet. I found it a little hard to wash my hair because the shower was so small as I lifted my arms I'd hit the side of the shower. This hotel is in an excellent location and is walking distance to Times Square and a lot of other tourist sites. When we book our room we also bought vouchers to get breakfast every morning. This was book through the hotel website. The hotel actually doesn't have restaurant facility so they sell voucher to a diner down the road. The food here is good but I would recommend that you go to the diner yourself without the vouchers as it works out cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location but tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelGuru
Reviews.Content: I think I read a couple of reviews that mentioned the rooms were on the small side, but I want people to clearly understand what they mean by small. If you have ever traveled through Europe...that kind of small. The rooms have space for the bed and a small desk... no extra space. I stayed in two rooms during my visit due to a problem with the heating, so I think the rooms size is based on which side of the building you are on. If you are book in a room to the right of the front desk, that appears to be an older tower, so tiny rooms and tiny bathrooms. To the left of the front desk the room was much bigger, closer to standard size, as was the bathroom. The bathroom in the room on the left tower also included a jazzuzi tub. I did enjoy my stay at this property, they had thick bath towels, nice bath products, clean rooms and contemporary design. The staff was very accomodating, especially when we got back to the room at 1am and the heat seemed very low. They immediately came to fix it. When it was 2am and getting colder we called again and they brought a space heater to fix the situation and then called me back in the morning to advise that they were going to switch us to a new room because of the issues with the heater. Nice follow through, I didn't have to call to remind them. The location is perfect, a ton of great restaurants on 9th street and of course Time Square on 7th. Quick and tasty breakfast at Cosmic Diner just around the corner on 8th. All in all, it's a great hotel for the price, just try to get a room in the wing to the left of the front desk (if you are facing the front desk). See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Cam_stark86
Reviews.Content: If you want space, supreme luxury & all the other non-essential over priced hotel things then this place is not for you. Let me tell who it is for. Travelers who love a good location. This in the heart of midtown, walking distance to subways, times squares, theatres, hells kitchen. Travelers who plan to spend their days out and about, not lazing about in their rooms. So the rooms are pretty simple and small. But they're very clean and the bathroom, showers and towels are lovely. We just loved coming back late at night, and having a restful sleep in a comfortable bed ready for the next big NYC day. There is wifi, a fitness room and very friendly staff ready to assist. We forgot our laptop the morning we left. We called and they put it in a hire car to JFK and we got it back just in time. Of course we had to pay but the staff were so attentive and this saved our trip! There is no buffet breakfast included. So, summing up. Simple and comfortable accommodation. Great location. GREAT value. Seriously, you will struggle to do better for the location. We paid about $120 US per night for 10 nights (double room on special). If you don't need luxury, just generous necessity, this is your winner.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: 3mJ87
Reviews.Content: Very close to Times Square easy to catch public transport from and the stuff is very friendly and helpful. However the rooms are very small and a bit pricy for what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: minxSydney
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely find! Great location, clean & not too noisy. It was far enough away from the main Times Square, but very close to everything - Times Square, Central Park, Theatres, Subway, Restaurants..... . We were very happy to have stayed here. Other reviews I had read mentioned the smallness of the rooms, & we had two rooms for the 4 of us. We were very happy with our room, a deluxe with a king bed - we had plenty of room. But our adult sons were in a tiny tiny room, which overheated very easily also. |Upon booking (admittedly through a third party) we had been told that we would have a Queen bed & the boys would have twin Queen beds. Instead we had a King bed & they had twin single beds, in a TINY room. We went to Reception to sort this out & they were very helpful, & ended up moving the boys to a Deluxe single room, as they weren't fully booked & had a bit of latitude. We were there for 9 nights, so we were very grateful that the boys were more comfortable. We had also requested upon booking, that the rooms be near to each other, but they were on opposite sides of the building & four floors apart. You had to go down to the foyer to access the other half of the building. When they relocated the boys to the Deluxe Single room, it was on the same side of the building as our room & only one floor down. This is a little thing I know, but I was slightly disappointed that when we would come in the front door, only once did someone on the reception desk greet us. I would try to catch their eye each time, but they rarely would even look at who was coming in, or would turn & talk to another staff member instead of responding to my smile & greeting. Not a big issue by any means, but a little thing that could go a long way in my book. It didn't diminish our stay though! We would definitely recommend this hotel & would definitely be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ewmorningstar
Reviews.Content: Our visit was over the Christmas holiday. As other reviewers had mentioned the rooms are small even for New York... So much so that we burst out laughing when we saw the room. Figured out that the suitcases would fit under the end of the bed then headed out for adventures. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: LondonTbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2011 for 5 nights. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The bed was huge, there was free air con, a safe, a flat screen TV, free WiFi, an iron and ironing board and a lovely bathroom with power shower. Considering the price we paid we were very pleasantly surprised! The location is excellent, being so close to Time Square and Hell's Kitchen, meaning that subway stops, shops and restaurants are only a few minutes walk. Even though the street was noisy we always managed to sleep, but I would recommend taking ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. The staff were very friendly and helpful and ensured we got a decent cab to the airport after we got scammed on the way into NY. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - worst hotel I have stayed at in NYC”
Reviews.Author: krustyfries
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. Rooms tiny, noise unbearable and the service poor. The rooms are ridiculously small, and they have not panned at all. No side tables on either side of the bed, no powerpoints anywhere near the side of the bed. No powerpoints available near the desk. (I have a lot of gadgets to charge!) The noise was terrible. We had a room facing the street, which must be a major truck thoroughfare. Trucks thundered down the street 24/7. There was also noise from the bars and restaurants across the street (but you would expect that in NYC). AC the noisiest I have ever had. Also the street noise came though the gaps in the window, I don't think there was any sound proofing at all. Service was poor to average. Surly people on the desk, doormen who never bothered to open the door (even when you were hauling suitcases) and concierges who could not recommend a thing! My mum was charged $16 for an international phone call that didn't even connect and they told us this was standard practice! I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone, I have stayed at much better places for a similar price. The only good thing about this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Swede_Maria
Reviews.Content: This is a really good value for money- hotel. Always clean and tidy, but rooms are very small. Had a Queensize bed to share with my friend, and nowhere to put our luggage, so had to move around them all the time! Stayed 5 nights and therefore got a good discount on the rates. Location is great, close to Times Square and subwaystations, but yet too far away to get all the noice! The neighbourhood is very quiet, so you sleep very well! Free wireless internet is a real good thing- and it worked like a charm every day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yiota14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was near everything. We stayed here for Thanksgiving weekend. We walked everywhere the entire time. We were blessed with great weather the whole weekend. You are really in the middle of nearly every attraction in the city. If you stay here, make sure you have dinner one night at Cara Mia, which is walking distance from the hotel. Best homemade Italian food I've had in a long time. Ate every bite! Overall, this hotel is clean, you get your own bathroom (you never know in NYC), and the beds are pretty comfy. The rooms are small, but we weren't picky about that at all. We were barely in the room anyways. The only gripe we had was that it was warm in there and the blinds would not stay up. But we cranked the AC or opened the window and it was fine. I thought the staff were nice. Valet parking is questionable. I say this only because I got my car back and it appeared that my radio had been played with. The time and settings were off. I didn't like that very much, but still not a huge deal. It also took them a while to bring my car to me when we checked out. However, I was glad to get my car back damage free.

Reviews.Title: “Small Wonder”
Reviews.Author: 2SunSisters
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Washington Jefferson Hotel for 3 nights for business. It was a great location because it was near my work location, Times Square, the subway and there were several restaurants and bars literally all around it. The hotel is a boutique hotel and the young woman at the front desk was a little cold but professional, so this was more than acceptable. She told me I was upgraded from the standard queen I booked and as you can imagine I was delighted. I proceeded to the old elevator and found it charming to watch the gate open and close. I exited on the 3rd floor and proceeded down a narrow hallway. I am no stranger to small spaces because I lived in NY for a decade, but was shocked when I entered my room. The door almost touched the bed when I opened the door wide enough to get my suitcase through it. The space was well used as there was a queen size bed, desk and mini wardrobe in a very tight space. The flat screen tv was mounted on the wall behind the door. I swear, I had a minor attack of claustrophobia so I decided to go the store and get some staples then return. On the way out, I asked the cold front desk clerk about the square footage and she told me “this is a boutique hotel”. After I confirmed I was aware of this, she told me the square footage was 260. I told her there was no way and asked her to find out before I returned. Upon returning, someone from facilities told me it was 180 square feet. That seemed more like it. After I returned to the room and checked out the rest of the room. The bed was chic looking but it was very hard. There was one mattress and there was no real cushion, but I must admit I didn’t really have a problem sleeping during my stay. The highlight of the stay was the bathroom. It was beautiful. Definitely, well designed, beautiful tiles and surprisingly quite spacious. I suggest they start showing pictures of the bathroom on the website, because it might make the stay worthwhile. I also want to note that the only cold person was the young lady who checked me in. Everyone else was very friendly throughout the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bellesister
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to New York city and I didn't really know the areas well but from the reviews that i read about this hotel, it has a good location and quite good priced at that time so I chose this hotel. When i first arrived i thought i chose wrong. The streets are a bit quite and i was shocked to see the size of the room. It was very small for the two of us. It was even small for just one person and the door made a noise when we opened it. So i was a bit stressed out especially since we already paid in full for 7 nights stay. But the room was surprisingly clean and quiet. I hardly hear any noise from the street the whole time we stayed there. The best part about this hotel is the location. It's only about 2 blocks away from Times Square and it's convenient, we never have to take the subway or taxi. And the nearest subway station is alo not far from the hotel. I would consider staying here again the next time i'm in new york if i get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Darren R
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of some of the reviews read, and photo's we had seen. I was however left disappointed on arrival. There were some positives, but many negatives which were almost entirely borne out of an expectation set by the hotel, and avoidable. Positives - (these will be les detailed than the negtives, but not because they are less important) - Location was great. Only 10 mins from Times Sq, probably less, similar to Columbus circle and Central Park, and close to 2 Subway lines that both go all the way to the financial district without changing. It was far enough off however to avoid a lot of the noise and allow for a good night sleep. - Close to lots of little diners, some restaurants of all standards, coffee shops, and the house of brews for a last drink on the way home. - Rooms cleaned and re-made everyday with nice bathroom toiletries Negatives - The staff were very friendly in themselves, but their service was not as professional as it could have been. For example, on check in our room wasn't ready (at 3pm), and after 5 minutes waiting to find out how long it would be - so we could nip out for coffee - it suddenly was ready. This was a needless situation for a customer to see. This theme continued throughout our stay. - The lift had a heavy iron door on, like something out of a warehouse. I expected a cage lift to appear the other side. - There were office spaces to the left of the recpetion that was not sympathetically designed. Not a problem in itself, but not what you expect from a 3 1/2 star hotel. They have tried to retain some NY feel, but there are obvious areas that have been saved on. - No hotel bar, almost inexcusable, but no tea/coffee facilities or water in the rooms which is inexcusable. - Radiator with no function to turn off. I understand it is winter, but to have to use Air Con (that smelled like it had not been used/serviced) to cool down an artificially heated room seems ridiculous - Room was small and again whilst not in itself a problem, is only really suitable for 2 nights due to storage. - Furniture looked old and dated. This is one of the areas where i feel something had to be saved. In general, this hotel appeared to shoehorn in all the requirements to get its star rating - it has a 3 piece suite in reception a hairdryer and a bag to send laundry out for example. I just question what would have happened if i had actually used the bag. I get the feeling it was there for the star - but they hoped no-one would use it - and if they did it would be a clunky process. The problem is possibly within the rating system itself. There is a perception of 3 star, the decor, the greeting, the service, none of which can be measured and therefore the actual star is given on other things that can be measured. This hotel has either a) got it horribly wrong and believes that it has created a 3 star environment or b) done everything to get the 3 star and not concerned itself with what is perceived to be 3 star. There are other hotels around that are better at the same price point or similar but cheaper. I would not recommend this hotel unless you get a much better rate. I paid $250 per night (as part of a package) and consider this much too expensive. Overall, the trip was good and the hotel did not detract from this, but i wont stay there again. I apologise for the lack of any photo's, this was the first place we've ever been where there was simply no point in taking any. These are only my opinions, so please take them or leave them - i've only talked about things that are important to me as a customer and been as honest as I could. If these things aren't as important, some of the the other reviews may provide a better source of information to you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Honest Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TC46
Reviews.Content: If you want a good clean honest hotel at a reasonable price with fantastic easy location, then this is it. This hotel is a minutes walk from Times Square. Note: they do not have a restaurant or bar but with so many deli's and restaurants in NY to choose from it didn't spoil out stay. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate and the staff were very helpful. If you want good clean honest on a budget- choose this hotel, if you want 5* luxury at a price tag go elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small but confortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: pip_fanto
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here ealry October for a week. I have read a lot of reviews on this place and would agree that the room is small but we did opt for a king size bed... there was just enough room for our 3 suitcases but in saying that the room was clean and made every day. The bathroom was small as well but reasonable and the water pressure in the shower was great. I always get a little worried about that when everything is so tight! Also be aware there is no bar fridge in the room.The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and greeted us everyday with a smile. The hotel is situated one block away from multiple train lines and there is a supermarket around the corner if you need anything!! Time Square is a quick 10min walk away and 15mins in the other direction to Central Park. There was no problem walking around this area of a night time either. I would recommend this to friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in many ways”
Reviews.Content: The location of the WJ is superb. Near several subway stations and close to Times Square, but far enough away to avoid the noise, raucousness and crowds. Also, there are many restaurants nearby that are reasonable in price and appear to be good bets (also, McDonald's is a half block away and there is a Japanese restaurant in the hotel). Rite Aid and Duane Reade drug stores within a block or so. 5-10 minute walk to most Broadway theatres. The neighborhood seems very safe. My room was reasonably sized with a queen bed and combination desk and chest of drawers that was adequate for one or two people. The closet was sizable enough for two travelers. The bathroom was somewhat small, but immaculate and attractive, with stone tile on floors and walls. Only a shower, but it was of a good size. The decor and cleanliness of the room were excellent. The pillows are a bit on the lean size, so you may want to ask for more. AC worked well. If you want quiet, ask for a room away from the street, even though there's not much of a view. I had absolutely no problem with noise. The lobby is attractive and welcoming, and the staff was helpful and friendly. The WJ doesn't have a business center, but does have free WiFi that worked well. At least a small business center would be helpful, especially for printing from a computer, but the front desk will print something for you if you e-mail it to them.

Reviews.Title: “Washington Jefferson Hotel - Thank you :)”
Reviews.Author: Craig C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the WJ Hotel on my last 2 visits to New York and I will definitely be staying there in the future. I have stayed in both the Standard and Deluxe rooms, the standard rooms only critism is that they are small but if you have been to NYC before you will know that the only time you spend in the room is when you are sleeping. The Deluxe room is more spacious and had a nice view of the nearby skyscrapers. Both types of rooms are very clean and well kept, they have all been refurbished recently with new furniture and flatscreen TV's, I really couldn't fault them. The staff are fantastic. They are very polite and helpful and can't do enough for you. They really made us feel welcome. They are a class act. The hotel is also in a great location, about 15 minute walk to Central Park and about 10 minute walk to Time Square and Theatre District. There is also alot of nice restaurants and bars in the area. Check out House of Brews which is right next to the hotel and Famous Amadeus Pizza on 8th Avenue. Both fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mcampbell67
Reviews.Content: The Washington Jefferson is a small hotel on West 51st street, just off 8th Avenue. My wife and I stayed there in September 2011. Positives: -Location, it's a great for getting to Times Square and to Hell's Kitchen on 9th, where there are loads of cool bars, diners and restaurants. -Staff, really friendly and gave us good tips on places to eat. They were very attentive at all times, and even gave us a late check out when we told them our flight was mid-afternoon -Price, pretty reasonable for the location Negatives: - Room size, our room was pretty small, but this was because the bed was a King size and so didn't leave room for much else! Let's just say we had to be creative to get our cases open - Street noise, the air conditioning unit is attached to the bottom part of the window by way of a plastic screen where the glass should be. This means that street noise gets in very easily. The noise bothered us quite a bit on the first night, but we began to get used to it. If this is likely to bother you, I would ask for a room that doesn't look out onto West 51st street Overall, if you're the type of person that prefers a modern hotel with amenities etc then you should probably look elsewhere. However if you want an affordable, clean base to explore NYC, and you probably won't be in your room except to sleep, then you can't go wrong with the Washington Jefferson.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mestrips
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, great if you like staying out late. Staff were lovely v helpful & courteous. The room are tiny, really tiny, you'd wonder how housekeeping manages to make the bed once the suitcases are in! Great shower. But please ask for a room off the street, garbage trucks all night long, cars hooting horns with all the bars & restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great spot”
Reviews.Author: marskz
Reviews.Content: second stay at theWJH.This visit was as great as the last. Clean, well kept and in a good location,sites,theatre,shopping within walking distance.The staff all were very friendly and helpful, no request was too much.If you find yourself here ask for direction to "ELLENS STARDUST DINER" it was recommended by the staff and we found it to be a great reasonable and "entertaining" place to have breakfast.We are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Were we dreaming ?”
Reviews.Author: geofffallon
Reviews.Content: I am a long term user of Trip Advisor and in general have always found that by researching posted reviews of ones choice of Hotel has always paid off in the past. Enter the reviews of the Washington Jefferson Hotel in Manhattan, New York. We booked this Hotel for a seven day stay in the Big Apple recently largely based once again on Trip Advisor reviews of the property. As I "escaped" from this dreadful establishment after 24 hours, going to a nearby property that was actually slightly better value and as different as New York is from Kabul, that action will probably give members some idea of what awaits them in this establishment. When one arrives you are met with the Reception area. This contains several sets of some of the dirtiest net curtains I have ever seen anywhere in the world. Ok the Reception Staff are friendly enough but why should they not be when one is paying approx 370 US Dollars a night to stay in their shoeboxes of rooms. We opted for a standard room and realised that in New York that meant a small box with bed but we could not believe our eyes, when we actually arrived in this bijou space. There is a cheap bed surrounded by approx a 1/2 metre wide path over an old and dirty piece of carpet. One side of the bed would be within a half metre to the small window which looked out onto an internal courtyard which reminded me of some pictures I have seen of old Victorian jails. The air conditioning unit was emitting an awful noise and we complained within seconds of being shown to our cell, sorry I mean standard room. The unit was surrounded by one of the cleanest things in the room, which was a white tea towel, which appeared to prevent rain from seeping in the space that was present should the towel have been removed. There was a "wardrobe" which was approx 2 metres in height and may have allowed one guest to hang up a change of clothes for a one day stay. It looked as though it had been built by a small child. But wait, nothing could have prepared us for the racket the air conditioning unit made all night long which prevents the notion of sleeping entirely. We complained but nothing could be done. In fact we complained to the Management within 30 minutes of arriving as I could not believe that even in New York someone could have the audacity to charge 370 dollars a night for the pleasure of squeezing into this tiny space and not being able to sleep a wink all night. Now several other reviewers have mentioned the well appointed slate walled bathroom. The shower seals were covered in mould and it had the added design facility that when one was standing in the shower and was male by gender it would have been possible to use the faucet without moving out of the shower. The image on Trip Advisor does not in my opinion portray the condition of the actual room you have the pleasure of paying nearly 400 dollars per night to inhabit. We were offered the possibility after two nights of moving to an "upgraded room" with the added cost of 70 dollars a night for this dubious pleasure. We lasted one night and made our farewells deciding that we would rather cut our holiday short and fly home than spend one other night in this absolute rip-off of a Hotel. The reviews suggest that this is a dated but budget priced Hotel. Well I can assure anybody else that there are several 4 star Hotels within a 1/2 mile of this establishment that offer luxury accommodation for the same price and I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone unless they obtain a rate of less than 150 dollars per night. If this place has been updated I would hate to have seen it in its previous incarnation. I find it difficult to be objective in my description of this place. For the rate being charged it is an absolute disgrace and my sympathy goes out to anyone else who has the misfortune to have been duped by both the images and description of this establishment. New York is a fantastic city to visit but do not include the Washington Jefferson Hotel on your itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all round!”
Reviews.Author: Lorhin
Reviews.Content: From the super friendly staff to the great location (only 5-10 min walk to Times Square) you cannot go wrong staying at this hotel. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “updated but small”
Reviews.Author: Chazdal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the WJ in mid July 2011. Was a lovely hotel in a great location. It is evident that it is a much older building, but has recently been updated with quite modern fixtures. The staff was great and always helpfull. Our only problem was that the rooms were extreemly small. Luggage or anything extra CANNOT fit into the room. That was the only dissapointing thing. The hotel has on e resturant which serves Japanesse food and only served lunch and dinner. Getting breakfast wasn't so far off and did not seem inconvenient. Would have been nice to at least have coffee makers though and a bar fridge, but again the room was so small it would not be able to accommodate that. All in all was a good experience ! But this hotel is suitable for only short trips and the size of the space can really become annoying.

Reviews.Title: “"60 year old Dad and 17 year old son"”
Reviews.Author: Dennis C
Reviews.Content: A good experience. Room was clean and complete with what we needed. Everything worked. Very quiet place to stay. Room had two double beds.It was a small room but we both enjoyed coming back here after being out on the streets.The staff are very friendly,helpful and efficient. Restaurants , grocery shops, and bakeries(check out Amy's Bread shop) are within minutes. I would definitely stay here.. again. There are more upscale restaurants but the WJ has a style its own. Father Dennis and Son Jacob .....Halifax, Nova Scotia CANADA

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Small room”
Reviews.Author: SimenR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located smack in the middle of hells kitchen. There are a lot of places to eat and the subway is just one block away. The hotel is located on a street with very little traffic and the noise level is very low. The room was small and the bed very short. I'm not a tall person by any standard but my feet hung off the end more than once. The room was clean. Free Wifi is always a plus when you are planning your day when visiting a city. The fitness center is a nice touch but we didn't use it much. There's thread mill, some weights and that's pretty much it. It's very small and if more than one person is in there at a time it seems crowded.

Reviews.Title: “BLACK MOLD IN THE WINDOW UNITS FOR THE AIR CONDITIONER”
Reviews.Author: ChoseCarefully
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 nights and will NOT go back. The staff is friendly, however the air conditioner units are filthy. I opened the window unit and the Filter was filled with Black MOLD. The maintenance man came and cleared the little filter. We were out of the room when he came to clean it, when we got back to the Room I opened the Window Unit and the little fileter had been cleaned, however beind the filter were the coils. They were filled with Black MOLD. This time 2 maintenance man came with a vacuum cleaner and rags. They vacummed the Black MOLD from the coils and then wiped the Black MOLD off that the vacuum cleaner could not get. My daughter and I both developed chest congestion and a sore throat the very next day. We were so sick that we came home and went to the doctor immediately for antibotics. I would not recommend this hotel if you are alergic to Black MOLD and DUST.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful desk service. We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MassarelloFamily
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy to walk the theater district. Easy access to subway. Short walk to 46th street restaurant row.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel by all the main attractions in NYC”
Reviews.Author: 2jayhawks
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the WJ hotel in NYC. Great hotel, especially if you want to go to the theatre. It is one block away from Gershwin Theatre where Wicked is playing and about a 15 walk from Times Square. The rooms are ok, but definitely get a room with 2 queen beds. The bathrooms are lovely--very modern and chic with great toiletries. Very clean hotel! I was concerned about the bedbug craze here, but never fear. The room was spotless. Pillows were too soft, but so what. You are so close to everything, you won't spend any time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in Times square”
Reviews.Author: Leisuretraveler78
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a block from the subway and close to Broadway, also walking distance to Central Park. It was a decent size room for NYC and it was clean. My boyfriend and I wanted to go out to a jazz club at night and the staff did not really have any recommendations so we just ventured out on our own. No fitness center available though, but you get enough walking around NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - great staff, super location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: starkerama08
Reviews.Content: My best girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights on a girls vaca to NYC. The location was excellent. Quiet, safe street and a short walk to the restaurants in Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, Theatres and Rockefeller Centre. Easy access to the subway. All of the staff were extremely accommodating and very friendly, They went out of our way to help with whatever we asked and offered suggestions. The rooms were clean, updated and nicely decorated. Small, but that's standard for New York. The common areas were clean. My only complaint would be that the beds were a little hard but that is hardly a negative. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for a cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PB_Bird
Reviews.Content: OK, the building is old and on one of the hottest weeks in recent memory it was a little disappointing to have the corridors not be air conditioned, but the room was very cool. The rooms are small and spare, but well equipped. The bed was comfortable and the location could not be beat. Easy walks to everything. The hotel staff were also terrific - very friendly and helpful. And they keep the place scrupulously clean. We'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JBar6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, bed was comfy, staff was very helpful. I knew going in that it was going to be a small room, so i really can't complain - for the price and location on the 4th of july weekend - it was great. As I said, the staff was very helpful, telling us what subways to use and giving tips and directions. Just a tip - The House of Brews just down the street had decent food, great staff and good beer. We also ate at Georgio's Country Grill for breakfast - they open early, good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: Bex_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Really loved thishotel, location is fab, staff extremely helpful, rooms very clean, bathrooms have been redone so all good! Rooms are small but who needs a big room when you are in NY, the hotel is the perfect base to move around NY.

Reviews.Title: “Pray that the Internet works on your floor”
Reviews.Author: Thad_McIlroy
Reviews.Content: Great location, some good staff. The hotel is what it is: old, small, reasonably renovated. If you get a good price you won't feel too bad. I stayed for 3 happy days and then a very sad 4th day. They had put me on the top floor. No Internet, and lots of confusion about why not. I spoke to someone in the elevator who said that the Internet NEVER works on the top floor -- but the staff swore differently. And all but swore at me for causing a fuss. In New York a guest is as disposable as a razor blade. Just shut up and smile: they don't really care about you personally.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ModernGay
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at the WJ and each time it gets better. The price is unbeatable, the location is supreme - restaurant row is a block away and the street it is on typifies a New York neighborhood. The room is spare, clean and has a modern, airy feel despite is modest size. It has a nice Japanese restaurant off the lobby - I tried it on a previous trip and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KentMan79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WJ for a week and the location was fantastic! We were on 9th Av., just 2 blocks away from Broadway and the in the hart of New York. The hotel service was brilliant and the staff excellent, not that before going to any attraction make sure to ask the concierge as they may have discount vouchers i.e. Top of the Rock discount vouchers. Also if on budget have breakfast at Europa Cafe, great quality food at low prices. Finally, a big thank you once again to all at WJ (Chris, London etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel with confidence!”
Reviews.Author: sylvano
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly because of it's reputation (compared to other hotels) regarding bed bugs or lack of. This hotel was great for our budget & expectations. Prior to us arriving we changed the dates of our reservation so when we arrived, they had the original check-in dates. But they quickly upgraded us from a deluxe to a superior room for no extra charge, which was very nice of them. We were very happy with the room cleanliness & was a small but a decent size for the superior suite. The location was one the best in our opinion as it was close to many different attractions, great restaurants, and shops and subways. ALL of the staff are superb & all deserve a thumbs up !! We will come back to this hotel for sure! Can't wait to go back to NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, All you really need.”
Reviews.Author: CandE1152
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was on the small side but it is all you really need when staying in NYC, as the majority of time you are out exploring. Not much space to hang clothes etc but that was ok as i always live out of the suitcase anyway, no big deal. The Bathroom was clean but again, small. The power shower was awesome though to get the days City muck off you! Night time was quiet resulting in good nights sleep. We did have a room facing inwards towards the horrible quad with all the bins etc, but again, you dont go to NYC for a balcony view, not really an issue for us. Staff were always happy to help, even arranging airport transfer pick up for us which we were dreading doing as we had no idea what to do, so that was a bonus. This is the third time I've stayed here and would have no hesitation in doing so again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and I don't know what everyone is complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights at the start of June and had booked the normal sized room, not the slightly cheaper petite. On arriving I was a room on the first floor just behind the lobby and near the elevator. I was initially concerned that there would be too much foot traffic here but ended up being happy with the room location as it meant I did not have to use the elevator or climb the stairs. Hallway noise could be an issue for light sleepers but wasn't for me. Room wasn't very big but was acceptable for NYC standard and it was very clean which to me is more important. Fussy sleepers might complain about the hard bed but again that didn't faze me/ Flat screen tv on the wall is handy and free internet is always welcome addition to any hotel stay purely for convenience. Housekeeping was efficient and friendly even though I only let them in every second day as I didn't feel the need for service daily as I was hardly in my room. Yes, the hotel is 2 blocks from Times Sq and all the Broadway theatres but there is so much more that this hotel is close including 9th Ave restaurants. You can walk down to the west river and visit the Intrepid if that takes your fancy. The blue line C & E subway is down the road and from there you can get anywhere on the subway system with a few easy transfers. The guys working on the door were very cool and always up for a chat or joke in between helping guests. I booked a town car pickup to JFK the night before I left and the car was waiting for me when I walked out 10 minutes early the next morning to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Roymaboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Washington Jefferson Hotel in NYC in March 2011 and we were very pleased with the hotel room and the hotel in general. We arrived very late at night and there was absolutely no problem checking in with a friendly, businesslike greeting also. The room we had was on the 4th floor and whilst the room was compact, small perhaps, we had expected this, being New York after all...however, the room was very functional. The ensuite bathroom was fine...small, but again, very functional. There is not a lot of space for baggage I guess, but we had backpacks, so they slid under the edge of the bed easily enough and besides, we just took care walking around the baggage. This was no problem for us. The bed was comfortable and we had no issue with noise at all, which, along with cleanliness, is the major issue when we book a hotel room. So, on the noise and cleanliness scales, we were pleased. Location-wise, well, very close to Times Square if this is what floats your boat. Times Square holds no particular interest for us and the food options within this general area are touristy, however, it's a central area and easy to get anywhere, so again, not a bad area at all. Speaking of food, we enjoyed going to a BBQ restaurant called Daisy May's and this was absolutely brilliant. In fact, the BBQ food was as good, if not better than some of the BBQ places we went to in the south of America, later on. Interweb was free too...so, that was great. Anyway, the Washington Jefferson Hotel was really good for my wife and I and we would absolutely stay here again for future trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of NYC - but hotel could use some TLC”
Reviews.Author: newf1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 5 night stay in May. The purpose of our trip was to vacation in New York, taking in the sights and attractions. This hotel is in a great location and lends itself to doing a "little bit of everything" included Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, and is on the major route of the hop on/hop off bus tours which I recommend as a way to see the rest of New York. First of all, it's important that I mention how I came to book this property. I used Hotwire and was near confident I was getting a Hilton property but ended up getting this one. After reading up about the hotel, including numerous reviews on this sight, I was expected an average hotel, small rooms with good service. For the most part, that is what I got, but I should point out the following. This hotel is in need of some work, particularly in common areas such as hallways, elevators and stairwells. We checked in and inquired about an upgrade and was told they were giving us a "premium - which was very nice". I didn't recall premium being listed on the WJ website as an option. We took the elevator to the 2nd floor which is what I would describe as 30 year olds and in need of replacing (see photos). When we got the second floor, it was clear that the place needed some work (again, see photos). When we got into our room, I was shocked. Picture a queen bed, and picture at most, 1-2 feet around the bed and that was the perimeter of the room. VERY small. The biggest issue with the room was the way the air conditioning unit was installed. It was installed in the window, and on either side of the unit there was cardboard/paper which basically meant it was exposed to the outside. This meant the room, which faced 51st street was VERY noisy. We did not sleep at all. The following morning, I done something I have never done before and asked for a new room. I have to say, the front desk staff were very helpful and when we returned home from a day out, we were given a room on the 4th floor which did not face 51st street. This room was more spacious and acceptable for a week's stay. The only issue with this room was that the air conditioning unit did not work at all. It was a very hot and humid week in New York, so our room was like a SAUNA. However, again, when this was pointed out to hotel staff, it was fixed within a day or so, and we were given a special gift in room for our trouble. In closing, if you are looking for a low priced hotel room which is centrally located, this may be an option worth exploring. However, have a look at my photos so you'll know what to expect in terms of the room and the property overall. The lobby is really nice. The rooms are average, with little storage space for a long term stay. I would compare the size of the rooms to that of a cruise ship. The main issue is how dated the rest of the hotel is, including the stairwell and the elevator. With all of the available options in New York City, I would have to say I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Snapplegirl68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotels recently, as I was going to see a Broadway show. The location can't be beat! I was especially impressed with the helpful and friendly staff. At check-in I received a free upgrade. The room was very nice and the bed extremely firm ( which I like). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: katyannakelly
Reviews.Content: Having not been to NYC before and being given a lot of differing opinions on where the best place to stay is, we chose the Washington Jefferson Hotel based on what we thought was a central location and a reasonable price. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly and professional staff member and check in was made easy after a long day of travelling (delayed flight making this more painful than it needed to be!). We were given a city guide and a recommendation for where to get a light dinner. We also had requested a bath in our room on our online booking and this was given to us without prompting (which we often have to do). The room was small but not uncomfortably so for two people. My partner disliked the bed but I didn't have too much of a problem with it. Bathroom and bath small, but adequate and probably quite large for New York. The location is FANTASTIC, only a few minutes walk to Times Square. The food in the area was great. We asked for extra pillows and were given them immediately, the reception staff were helpful on the few occasions we needed assistance. Would highly recommend this hotel to people coming to NYC for the fist time, or who want to be close enough to Times Square to feel involved but not too close to have it impact on your sleep. My only concern with the room is the apparent lack of temperature control which may pose a problem in the hotter months. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definately going back!”
Reviews.Author: H_R_Block
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and loved it! Brilliant location, really friendly and helpful staff, room small but I'd prefer to call it 'cosy' ;) We got a room in the middle of the block, looking out onto a small concrete courtyard.... BUT, if you looked up you could see one of the many surrounding skyscrapers so you didn't forget where you were! Initially we were a little disappointed our room wasn't out on the street but after our first nights sleep (which we slept like babies) we were very glad to have the peace and quiet of the courtyard, and of course, no morning sun streaming in our room either. Phew! After each day of being on the go, we really looked forward to coming back to the hotel knowing it was gauranteed friendliness, cleanliness, close to our final sightseeing location, and quiet. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good place to stay with decent prices and a central location. We miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Standard room very small but clean and employees very nice.”
Reviews.Author: dawntakatsuki
Reviews.Content: The standard room is the smallest I've ever seen, measured it at 9'x9'. Barely enough room to walk around the bed, no room to open or store suitcases, no dresser and closet is very narrow. Suggest you get the deluxe for $20.00 more. Bathroom is clean, service was good, front desk and valet are great. Location is good close to theatres, subway and Times Sq. Japanese restaurant next door is excellent and you can enter from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: Carits
Reviews.Content: My 7-day stay at the Washington Jefferson Hotel was fantastic! Arrived in the afternoon and room was ready. Was pleasantly surprised when I found out that I was upgraded to at room with a bigger bed…yay! Asked for a fridge and it was delivered the very same day! The location is perfect walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Subway is just around the corner. The room was exceptionally clean and the staff were extremely friendly and would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Washington Jefferson Steps Up!”
Reviews.Author: star_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of the Washington Jefferson until this trip. This hotel is in an extremely PRIME location for New York. It is located at 51st and Broadway. Not only is the hotel a hop, skip and a jump away from Broadway, it is a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The location is unbeatable for the rate! Yes, the rooms are very small. However, there is a full size bathroom, two twin size beds that are BEYOND comfortable, and a television. For the city that never sleeps, that's all you need. The staff are very kind and accommodating. The first night, the room was way too cold so they sent up a portable heater. It was excellent service. Also, the concierge in the lobby helped give us directions as well as look up tickets for a basketball game and for shows. I would 100% stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KatarinaO1
Reviews.Content: Stayed sex nights and found it easy to walk or go by taxi or subway to shops and interesting spots. At least three really good restaurants on the street! Next door to hotel one of the cities best sushi restaurants, Shimizu. Small rooms, but comfortable beds and newly renovated bathroom. Very quiet. Located in the Theater District, close to Times Square and not far from Columbus Circle and Central Park. Nice and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Agility required.”
Reviews.Author: k258
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a larger room with jacuzzi upon arrival due to the internet being down. It was down for the entire weekend. Pros: Clean, no bed bugs, no bad odors, updated bathroom. Great location. Fairly reasonable price. Super quiet. Cons: Do not stay here if you have mobility problems. You have to be able to access your stuff from the floor. There was no place to put luggage or to unpack. No luggage stand, no dresser, no console, no counter space. Only a wobbly desk and nightstand. Insufficient shelf space in the bathroom. No control of the heat. We were cold during the day and hot at night. The utilitarian bed consisted of a very lightly padded Serta mattress on a board and plywood box. My companion found it uncomfortable, but I was okay. I have never seen narrower hallways. Overall, the bang for the buck wasn't bad. I'd stay here again if the price was right. Most of the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, wonderful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-NZgirl
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - only a couple of mins walk from Times Sq, and right in middle of the Theatre District. Lots of restaurants, supermarket and food market all within 1 min of hotel. Room was very nice - lovely linen and amazing bathroom. I had booked a single room, but was upgraded to full sized room on arrival. It was on the ground floor and very quiet. I had read reviews that were negative about the size of the room or the heating. My heating was fine - I found it a bit warm when I arrived, but just turned the heat down by adjusting the radiator. The linen was great - lovely pillows and sheets. And the bathroom was very cool and modern - with lovely toiletries (including 2 types of fancy soap). Great shower. I thought it was amazing value - check out their website for good rates too, especially if you stay for a couple of nights. And there were no bed bugs or reports of bed bugs which is always good for a New York hotel! Wifi in rooms, and looked like you could watch internet on the flat screen tv (but I didnt spend long enough in room to investigate that).

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Andy9761
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short. All NY hotels are small, this one is no different. Rooms cleaned daily, service is brilliant, location is perfect. Noisy heating the only issue, but sorted within the hour. Would use again

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the right price and location!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel155043
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just travelled down to New York. It was our first time there and we wanted to stay someone close to all the action, a place that was affordable and safe. We booked our stay at the Washington Jefferson and it was great. After reading some reviews I was a bit concerned on what to expect, so heres my comments on it: -The rooms are small but liveable. Some reviews made it out to be unbareable but it it fit both my friend and I perfectly, luggage, and all! I found the rooms to be very clean and we never really had any noise issues at night. For the amount of time I spent in my room I barely noticed the size. Also I read on here that the beds were rock hard and the pillows were flat; The beds in our room were comfy and the pillows were fine, its not a five star hotel here so i dont know what some people are complaining about. -The front desk was pleasent and always available to answer questions about getting around the city. -The location is great and safe! Its not even a 5 minute walk and your already in time square. From the location of the hotel we were able to walk to virtually every major sight in NYC. We had take the subway only once to go see the Statue of LIberty and the station was just down the street and you literally just got on the subway and stayed on till the last stop! -There is a nice little restuarant right across the street called Vise Versa. Its reasonably priced and I recommend checking it out. So overall you get what you pay for and I would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the WJ, would return.”
Reviews.Author: Chadderz
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews we were quite concerned that our stay would not be good, however, with one or two minor exceptions we had a great stay here. Reception staff are fantastic, can't do enough for you. Had problem with hissing from radiator on check-in to our room, fixed within the hour! Rooms are very small, but quite stylish and clean. Good quality bath and bed linen. Stairwells and corridors very dingy and dark, in need of a lick of paint. Location is just fantastic, 5 mins walk to Times Square, across street for subway station. Bar at end of street, House of Brews very good, lovely food and great atmosphere. We went to two Ice Hockey games during our stay, Rangers at MSG and Islanders at Nassau Coliseum on Long Island, both had fantastic atmosphere and great crowd, our longest road trip to date!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer72
Reviews.Content: This was my 12th visit to NYC and the first time staying at the WJ Hotel. Great location, easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway Theatres and just around the corner from the closest subway. Love the free Timeout magazine - nice touch. I specifically look for hotels that supply free wi-fi (I think it's absolutely compulsory) and the WJ does just that. The staff on reception are fabulous. Really helpful and super friendly. Now, the room ... OK, so I've stayed in some small hotel rooms and this was by far the smallest room ever! But, when you're in NYC you don't spend time in your hotel room until you're too exhausted to move anyway. But, be warned fellow travellers, if you like a bit of floor space or you're into swinging cats, this is not the place for you. I, however repositioned some of the furniture and made it work. The bathroom was super small and I ended up leaving the door open to give the room a feeling of a little more space! But considering the price I paid for the room, this wasn't really too much of a hassle. The bed was pretty hard and the pillows flat but it was ok. The room was kept reasonably clean, although a freshen up of the carpet would be most welcome! I also had a problem turning off the heating. On my first night, despite it being freezing outside, my room was like a sauna. The next morning, reception promptly sent up a maintenance man and he turned the heating off for me. It stayed off for the 10 days of my stay and was fine. Despite the teeny tiny living quarters and the bed being right next to the door (and I mean right next to the door), this hotel was great value for money. I thought it was such good value, I've just booked my return visit.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: feynman82
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom was clean but very, very small. We got some trouble to arrange everything with our luggage, but it was Ok in the end. Wi-fi was included 6 worked. The location of the hotel is great, close to the tube and plenty of attraction. There is a very cool french bar called "tout va bien" on the opposite side of the street, we had some great fun there! We felt however a kinda ripped-off, when we ordered a cab via the receptionist to get to JFK: He recommended to take a town car as we have a lot of luggage. He stated a price of about 60 dollars, when it arrived the driver wanted 100 dollars. We decided then to take a regular cab which was just 45 dollars and perfectly fine for us and our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Rikkard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Jan 2011. The hotel is pretty average, nice but small rooms, free wifi, plenty of chanels on flatscreen TV. Great location for times square, and lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Noisy radiator whixh the guest has no control over so you are either boiling or freezing. Overall worth what we spent on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel located on the outskirts of thwe Broadway district, provided a comfortable night's stay during a huge snowstorm. The staff was very friendly and the lobby quaint and clean. There was only one elevator and most of the time it was quicker to walk the 4 flights to my room rather than wait. The room was pretty small and plain but it was clean with a nicely stocked bathroom. I booked this Hoter on Hotwire for about $100, and for a NYC hotel with prime location, it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay despite a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Nomad580
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the WJH over new year. Positives: 1. The location is unbeatable. -Times Sq is a short stroll from the hotel -There are great restaurants/Cafes on 8th & 9th Ave' sat the end of the street. - Subway is literally a minute walk from the hotel, but we rarely used it anyway finding it easy enough to walk most places despite the snow! 2. Staff are very professional and helpful. A shout out to housekeeping who do a brilliant job. 3. Price was reasonable for its location and time of year. Negatives: 1. HEATING!! This was our major downfall. The heating is centrally controlled and being on an upper level our room was absolutely boiling at night so much so we had the bedroom and bathroom windows fully open, despite it being below freezing outside. Very dehydrating! 2. Our bed was rock hard, it was literally a mattress on what looked like a plank of wood. Weird at first but after a long day sight-seeing we soon learned to zonk out on it! 3. Pillows were hollow and lumpy offering no support. (I should have probably asked for different ones). 4. Rooms were on the smallish side but not as bad as people have spoken about on here - its New York you make do!! Overall I would still recommend it. We had a substantial stay at the hotel and I was a little disappointed we didn't get any sort of recognition of that in terms of additions/specials. Last notes..the doorman was great, as were the male reception staff, however the female receptionists were not as friendly. I would go back and I very much heart NY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, hard beds, noisy in the front facing rooms”
Reviews.Author: andyjh1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over New Year 2010 / 2011 for 5 nights. The bad points: - Rooms are TINY. - Beds are hard. - Rooms at the front of the property are VERY noisy due to poor sound proofing from the street. - The first room we were in was too warm, and we had no control over the heating. - No dining facilities on site, so you have to go out for breakfast. The good points: - Location is good - close to Times Square, but not so close that it's a nuisance. Also very close to a subway station on the A, C and E lines. - Staff were helpful in moving us to a slightly larger room that was quieter (near the back of the property). - Relatively cheap. Overall, we expected better, and I wouldn't call this a 3 star hotel. A little more detail: On the first night, we asked to be moved to a larger room, and for some padding to be put on the bed (it was like a plank of wood). They said they couldn't do anything until the morning, as the house keeper had gone home and there were no larger rooms available until the next day. In the morning, we checked with them and they said they had a larger room available (at the expense of having a smaller bathroom), which was also quieter (we complained about the noise in the morning, having been constantly woken up in the night be people & vehicles outside). They moved our stuff whilst we were out for the day. The second room we were in had a bit more space, but the bathroom was tiny (barely room to dry yourself). Happily though, it was away from the road so much quieter, and they'd put a bit of padding on the bed so it was slightly more bearable. The radiators weren't on in the room for some reason, so it was also a more comfortable temperature. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel, as it's pot luck which room you end up with. If you're lucky and get one of the slightly larger and quieter rooms, and don't mind sleeping on hard beds, then it's reasonable value for money. We'll be staying elsewhere next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Midtown business”
Reviews.Author: WCoastFLman
Reviews.Content: I don't spend much time in hotels' rooms. They're there only for the essentials like sleep, shower and putting down my bags. So when my room rate was under $200 during a Xmas time business trip I grabbed this 'single room' for one. It came as advertised--small with a twin bed, flatscreen TV, shower bath with all the necessities. The room (#683) was unusually quiet for NYC, with only the radiator making an occasional hiss during the night--the typical NYC street traffic just wasn't there! The whole hotel has been updated fairly recently with modern fixtures, wall paper, bath finishes and furnishings throughout. The room was made up/cleaned on a timely basis each day. For a midtown trip at a good rate this is a favorable choice with nothing to make the stay regrettable. The old elevator moves slowly though---wait, hike or choose a low floor. The bell and desk staff are A+ and always available and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but hope you packed light.”
Reviews.Author: MDinCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work conference. Took a gamble by not going for a known commodity (i.e. Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn, etc.). Booked through Hotels.com for 3 nights and prepaid. Due to the holidays, hotel prices were jacked up. Paid nearly twice as much for a room than I paid when I was last here in April. Staff was friendly and accomodating, although the room was suprisingly smaller than anticipated. The bathroom was tight and room totaled about 150-200 sq ft. The location was ideal as it was 4 blocks from my conference and the best price considering the location and timing. Would I recommend it? Probably to some college kid backbacking through the city looking for adventure and a bed to lay your head at night. Oh yeah, no bed bugs either. Considering the epidemic in NYC, this was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, small room and not cheap - but aren't they all here?”
Reviews.Author: skyjockey99
Reviews.Content: The room for 4 nights cost as much as flights for 2 from London :-( However, good location, and if you're hitting the sights, you'll only need a bed. Small shower/bathroom was stylish but bend down to clean your teeth and you'll knock the door open... Facilities include flat screen TV, wifi/free internet, and room safe - and you'll have to put bags under the bed.
